h3. Summary
When adding JIRA Road Map gadget to Confluence and loading gadget, the gadget does not populate and an error appears in the JavaScript console.

h3. Environment
* Confluence 6.2.0
* JIRA 7.3.6

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up Application Links between Confluence and JIRA
# Add the JIRA Road Map Gadget to Confluence in *General Configuation* > *External Gadgets*. The XML link is from the JIRA gadget page, it will be something like
{code}
http://jira.mycompany.com:8080/jira/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.jira.gadgets:road-map-gadget/gadgets/roadmap-gadget.xml
{code}
# Edit a new page in Confluence
# Open the JIRA Road Map gadget from *Other Macros*

h3. Expected Results
Gadget will populate and can be edited

h3. Actual Results
The JavaScript console throws
{noformat}
com.atlassian.jira.gadgets:core-gadget-resources.js?locale=en-AU:12 Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'value' of undefined
    at Object.projectsAndCategoriesPicker (com.atlassian.jira.gadgets:core-gadget-resources.js?locale=en-AU:12)
    at Object.descriptor (ifr?container=atlassian&mid=17181245440&country=GB&lang=en&view=default&view-params={"writable"%3A"…:459)
    at descriptor (com.atlassian.gadgets.publisher:ajs-gadgets-lite.js:39)
    at com.atlassian.gadgets.publisher:ajs-gadgets-lite.js:6
    at Object.reqOptions.success (com.atlassian.gadgets.publisher:ajs-gadgets-lite.js:6)
    at Object.success (com.atlassian.gadgets.publisher:ajax.js:24)
    at Object.AG.ajax.handleCallbacks (com.atlassian.gadgets.publisher:ajax.js:6)
    at Function.AG.ajax.anonymous.handleResponse (com.atlassian.gadgets.publisher:ajax.js:18)
    at com.atlassian.gadgets.publisher:ajax.js:18

and the Road Map is empty

No workaround.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This issue does not affect instances which use the internal synchrony proxy. This means *most non data center instances running 6.2.1+ should not be affected*. See --CONFSERVER-52393-- for details .
{panel}
If using XHR fallback mode, synchrony will sometimes return headers like the following. "Set-Cookie: JSESSIONID=dummy". This will cause the current user to be logged out.
h3. Steps to reproduce

You will likely need a proxy to reproduce this bug - the internal synchrony proxy is not suitable as it has been patched.
 # Setup Synchrony and Confluence on the same domain and port. Confluence must be configured to run on the root of the domain. ie [http://localhost:8080/]
 # Disable websockets so that Confluence will use XHR fallback mode
 # Logout and clear all cookies
 # Add a random cookie via the console
{code:java}
document.cookie = "this.is.important=false;"
{code}

 # Login to confluence and edit a page
 # Notice the xhr and xhr_send requests return a Set-Cookie header which consequently log you out

h3. Possible Workarounds
 * Use the internal proxy
 * Filter out Set-Cookie headers at the external proxy
 * Rename the Session cookie tomcat uses as shown in  [Option 2 section|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/logging-into-another-atlassian-application-logs-me-out-of-confluence-268043930.html]
fields.summary: Synchrony will sometimes return Set-Cookie headers if using XHR fallback mode

fields.description:
This ticket stems from -CONFSERVER-45966-. In that ticket, if you enter a link that contains url-encoded characters such as %25 or %2f, etc., those characters became double-encoded.

The resolution in CONFSERVER-45966 resolved most of these characters including all umlaut and cyrillic characters per the description of that ticket.

The problem is that there are certain characters which when encoded in the link are still being double encoded.

Those characters are: "; , / ? : @ & = + $". The encoded versions of these characters are: "%3B %2C %2F %3F %3A %40 %26 %3D %2B %24" and if the link contains any of the encoded version, that character will be double-encoded.

 
h3. Workaround

Option 1: Paste the link into the editor instead of using insert link dialog.
 * In this method you cannot modify the link text, so the link text will be automatically set based on the url

Option 2: Use square brackets to insert the link. [ ]
 # Type "["
 # Type the text you want for your link in the editor, for example "My Link"
 # Type a "|"
 # *Type* the url
 # Type "]" to complete the link.
 # Save or preview the page to confirm it works.
 # *Important!* Don't open the link dialog for this link. If you do, the link will be double-encoded.

For step 4, you could also try pasting the url but this might have less success since the url will be converted to a link automatically and you might have to first undo that automatic conversion, which in turn may cause the closing "]" to have no effect. See option 3 instead.

Option 3
 # Paste the URL into the editor.
 # Press undo to undo any automatic link creation/extraction so you see the original URL.
 # If the URL is still a link, click it, and click "Unlink" to return it back to regular text.
 # At the beginning of the link, type [ followed by `Escape` to exit the Link Autocomplete
 # Type the text to display for the link followed by "|"
 # Now your link should look like this
 ## !Screen Shot 2017-05-11 at 7.37.39 AM.png|width=379,height=48!
 # Click at the end of the link and type "]" to complete the link. This should auto-convert it to a link with the desired text.
 # Save or preview the page to confirm it works.
 # *Important!* Don't open the link dialog for this link. If you do, the link will be double-encoded.

 

Option 4: Using the Source Editor to change links after adding them
 # Install the [Confluence Source Editor|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.editor.confluence-source-editor/server/overview] (free add-on)
 # Edit the page
 # Click on the {{<>}} icon in the top right
 # Find the *href=* attribute that contains the '%25' in the URL
 # Replace it with just '%'
 # Apply the changes and save the page
fields.summary: Links containing certain encoded special characters become double-encoded

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When placing macros back to back the editor injects an erroneous line break that can be seen in the editor, but once the page is saved or previewed the space is not present.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page in Confluence 6.1.x
 # Insert a {{note}} macro one after another
 # You'll see a line break between the two macros:
 !line_break_rich_text_editor.png|thumbnail!
 # Hit Save

h3. Expected Results

There should be a line break between the two macros
h3. Actual Results

There is no line break between the two macros:

!no_line_break_viewer.png|thumbnail!

However, when you go back into the editor, you see the line break again:

!line_break_rich_text_editor.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes
 * If you remove the line break in the editor and save, the next time you edit the line break will be present again
 * If you preview the page, you'll see the line break disappear
 * If you delete the line break and preview, and go back to the editor, the line break is gone, but will reappear the next time you edit the page
 * With the {{code block}} macro, deleting the line break between the macros will just delete the {{code block}} macro entirely

h3. Workaround

There is no workaround at this time
fields.summary: Rich Text Editor injects line breaks between macros that are not honored in the preview or page viewer once the page is saved

fields.description:
h3. Summary The Collaborative Editing is changing(removing) the HTML markup from pages. If you disable the Collaborative Editing, the markup remains. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Disable the Collaborative Editing. # Go to any existing page. # Paste the following CSS through the Source Editor: {code:html}

Testing Padding Styling

{code} # Save the changes. # Edit the page again. # The style will continue to use the "padding" html code. # Update the "padding: 25px" to "padding: 50px"(through the Source Editor again). # Save the changes. #* Confluence will show the changes. # Enable the Collaborative Editing. # Edit the page. # Go to the *Source Editor*. # The "padding" parameter is missing. h3. Expected Results The "padding" will continue to exist during the editing mode. h3. Actual Results If the Collaborative Editing is ON, the changes("padding" in this example) will disappear upon page edit initiation. h3.Workaround No workarounds.

h3. Summary

"Chart by" filter not picking Number Fields from Custom Fields list

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* Confluence 6.1.0
* JIRA 7.3.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# *In JIRA*, go to the "Custom Fields" page.
# Create two custom fields.
# Create one as *Number Field* and the other as *Labels*.
# Reindex JIRA and Confluence.
# *In Confluence*, go to any page and insert a *JIRA Chart* macro.

No workarounds

fields.description:
h3. Summary
WebDAV does not work with Crowd SSO using Finder on MacOS

h3. Environment
* Mac OS X
* Finder (native file explorer)
* Crowd SSO configured with Confluence

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure Crowd SSO with Confluence: [Integrating Crowd with Atlassian Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/crowd/integrating-crowd-with-atlassian-confluence-198573.html]
# Open Finder and follow this guide: [Configuring a WebDAV client for Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/configuring-a-webdav-client-for-confluence-148044.html]

h3. Expected Results
When connected, you should see Confluence content in a file system structure

h3. Actual Results
Finder window displays an empty folder

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-confluence.log file:
{noformat}
2017-05-15 11:45:32,483 ERROR [http-nio-8090-exec-2] [integration.seraph.v25.CrowdAuthenticator] getUser Could not find cookieToken from authenticated request
 -- url: /confluence/plugins/servlet/confluence/default/ | traceId: 4e92279172ad6bd8
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
Use a different platform or a third-party tool such as [Cyberduck|https://cyberduck.io/?l=en]

fields.description:
Hello,

I had a hell of a time getting my user macros to work until I realised that the body that I was receiving was already decorated with HTML. (Obvious in hindsight, but not at the time.)

Eventually, to make it work I had to get the DisplayTool from VelocityEngine GenericTools, make a custom plug-in for Confluence, and use the stripTags() method to get at the internal text of the body that I was receiving.

It seems like such a common operation, I highly recommend that GenericTools be added to the standard Confluence install, and that the DisplayTool (at least; better all of them) be added to the context of user macros.

 

Thanks,

 

Peter.
fields.summary: Add VelocityEngine GenericTools to standard Confluence

fields.description:
Using superscripts and subscripts is hard. There is no keyboard shortcut for getting into superscript or subscript, so have to always go back to the toolbar. 

When using the toolbar, if you place your cursor where you want to type the superscript, and the select superscript from the toolbar, the cursor is no longer where you placed it. Who knows where it is. You have to try to click back to where you want to place your superscript, but even that sometimes fails.

The only viable way to do this is to first type the thing you want to be a superscript and then highlighting it and choosing superscript from the menu. But even then, how do you continue typing? You have to place the cursor back to the end of the superscript to continue typing normally.
fields.summary: Make it easier to use superscript and subscript

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, the Synchrony proxy health check is used to check whether the Synchrony proxy is running and responding to requests. It requires a HTTP connection. If a HTTP connector is not present in {{server.xml}} (for example you're only using a HTTPS or AJP connector) the health check will fail even if the Synchrony proxy is operational. If the connectors in {{server.xml}} are defined in the wrong order, the detection will also fail.
h3. Suggestion

To optimise the Synchrony health check condition, allow Confluence/Synchrony to auto-detect the correct protocol in {{server.xml}}. If the {{server.xml}} file is already parsed to detect the correct port, it should be easy to also detect the correct connector and protocol.
fields.summary: Optimise the Synchrony health check

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If you create an RSS feed link using the Confluence Feed builder, it creates the link but it's not possible to use it in the RSS Feed Macro.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Go to Confluence Dashboard.
# Click the "?" button in the superior bar and then "Feed Builder".
# Select what you intend to pull up using the RSS feed link.
# Create RSS
# Click on the "atom feed" button to get the link. As you can see, it says Access:	Authenticated (Login is required for this feed)
# The URL will depend on what you've selected to show in step 3.
# Now go ahead and create a page in Confluence.
# Insert the RSS Feed Macro and try to use the URL generated in step 6.
# Even if the space that you've selected to get information from has Anonymous access enabled, you still get an error after saving the page:

{{Could not retrieve ........ - Page not permitted}}

h3. Expected Results

You should be able to provide credentials in the RSS feed URL, as well as happens in Fisheye for example. And if a Space has no restrictions and Anonymous access enabled, the RSS feed link should show the information without permission errors.

h3. Actual Results

You get a " - Page not permitted" error after saving the page with the RSS feed link inserted.
fields.summary: RSS feed link created not acessible

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

PDF product documentation for FishEye, Crucible, and Confluence are hosted in the Atlassian Cloud (Bitbucket.org) and redirected to Amazon AWS while the other product documentation is hosted directly on Atlassian.com.

If this is not known, we are unable to retrieve the PDF downloads on a restricted network.

h3. Suggested Solution

Please include a note or reference for those on restricted networks that the PDF documentation resides elsewhere to open up network access.
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/alldoc/applications-and-tools-documentation-directory-209586313.html
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/atlassian-cloud-ip-ranges-and-domains-744721662.html
fields.summary: Update documentation to include reference PDF download location

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When running Space Import, there is no easy way of knowing which spaces we just imported.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be very helpful to list the space names that were imported along with a hyperlink on each listing that would take you to that space.


h3. Workaround
The only workaround at the moment, is to extract the XML Space Backup, open entities.xml and look for the {{spaceKey}} and find out which spaces it contains.
fields.summary: Space Import to list the imported spaces

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When the [Table of Contents|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/table-of-contents-macro-182682099.html] or [Table of Contents Zone|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/table-of-content-zone-macro-189890742.html] macros are on a page, the [in-place editing function introduced in Confluence 5.9.x|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/confluence-5-9-release-notes-785333580.html#Confluence5.9ReleaseNotes-Editapage,withoutlosingyourplace] does not work as expected.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page with several paragraphs text, enough to require scrolling through the page
 # Include different headers and sections
 # Add a Table of Contents macro or the Table of Contents Zone macro
 # Save the page
 # Scroll to the middle of the page in view mode
 # Press *E* or click *Edit* on the hovering page data toolbar

h3. Expected Results

Confluence should take you to the same general area that you were when viewing the page
h3. Actual Results

You may receive a few different results:
 # The editor does not move and just focuses at the top of the page
 # The editor focuses on a different spot on the page, unrelated to the spot you had scrolled to in view mode

There are no errors in the log files.
h3. Workaround

The only workaround at this time is to remove the Table of Contents and Table of Contents Zone macros if they are in use
fields.summary: Table of Contents and Table of Contents Zone macros affect in-page editing feature

fields.description:
Confluence cannot be fully used on Alpine linux distribution without further tweaking and customization. See [CONFSERVER-52400|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-52400] for more details.

Our documentation should be able to show that it's not supported as an OS for Confluence.
fields.summary: Confluence doesn't support Alpine linux distribution

fields.description:
Alpine linux distribution doesn't natively include Bash, and has OpenJDK Java which is not supported with Confluence.

Add support for Alpine linux and optimize installers and our code to work out of the box with it.
fields.summary: Add support to Alpine linux

fields.description:
Hi,

Editing features. It would be great if you guys extended Synchrony to be a general purpose RTC service that could be used by add-ons that need real-time collaboration.

For example, our Lucidchart OnPrem for Confluence Server add-on (and similar productivity tools) could use the service as a real-time collaboration back-end to allow simultaneous editing of diagrams. Right now we implement a quasi-realtime collaboration through polling attachment versions.

Please let me know if this is something you would be willing to consider in the future. I'm happy to provide additional details.

 

Thanks
fields.summary: Expose Synchrony as a general purpose RTC service

It shows "Login & Approve" message

{code:java}
2017-05-10 15:20:54,281 ERROR [http-nio-8090-exec-7] [calendar3.rest.ExceptionMappers.GeneralExceptionMapper] getResponseError Could not authenticate to Jira instance

fields.description:
Summary

Currently, only the task assignee received the "marked a task complete/incomplete" when the task is marked as complete. This is unintuitive as the task assignee does not need the notification as he/she is the one that will be marking the task as complete in the first place. It would be more beneficial for the watcher of the page to receive this notification.

 

Current Behaviour:
 # User1 modifies a page and assigns a task to User2
 # User2 marks the task as complete
 # Only User2 received the *marked a task complete/incomplete* if the *Notify on my Action* option is enabled

Desired Behaviour
 # User1 modifies a page and assigns a task to User2
 # User2 marks the task as complete
 # User1 received the *marked a task complete/incomplete* 
 # User2 received the *marked a task complete/incomplete* if the *Notify on my Action* option is enabled
fields.summary: Send "marked a task complete/incomplete" to all the watcher of the page.

fields.description:
h3. Summary While using Firefox you're trying to remove user mentioning link using "Unlink button" the mentioning formatting stays in the storage format. h3. Environment Any supported client configuration with Firefox. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a new page # Add a User Mention # Save the page # Edit the page # Click on the user mention and remove the link using "Unlink" button # Save the page. Examining the page source code you can see that:
  • Edit the page # Mark the no longer linked Full Username with the keyboard (cursor keys) or by using the mouse (but NOT by hitting the left mouse button three times, thus marking the whole line) and overwrite the user name by some text, eg. "Hello World" # Save the page. "Hello World" is rendered as a user mention. h3. Expected Results The link and the formatting of the user mention are removed. The storage format: {code}

    Username

    ewrewre

    ewrewr

    ewr

    {code} h3. Actual Results The link is removed but user mention formating still in place The storage format: {code}

    Username

    dsfsdff

    dsfsdfdsdfds

    fdsfsdds

    {code} h3. Notes The bug seems to be Firefox only regression of CONFSERVER-37328
fields.summary: Unlinking mentioned user does not remove mention formating in Firefox

fields.description:
Our customers are noticing that our mail notification size can be rather large (about 500 KB or more).

In order to fix the issue, these are potential valid options:
 * Option to limit email file size (truncate reset)
 * Option to send email as a plaintext.
 * Option to switch template if email size exceeds desired limit.
fields.summary: reduce Confluence email notification size

fields.description:
h3. Environment

This bug has only been reproduced when using collaborative editing XHR fallback mode.
h3. Symptoms

When editing a page, the user is logged out of Confluence. The user will be able to continue editing the draft but will not be able to publish it. The following flag saying "Looks like your session expired. Log in again to keep working" will be displayed.
 !Session expired flag.png!
h3. Workarounds
h5. 1. Use Websockets for collaborative editing

This bug only affects XHR fallback mode. Confluence will use XHR fallback mode if a user cannot connect to Confluence via WebSockets.
h5. 2. Clear Cookies 

This bug occurs when there is more than just the JSESSIONID Cookie stored against the Confluence domain.
 # Logout from Confluence
 # Remove all stored Cookies from the Confluence domain
 # Login again with remember me *unchecked*
 # Ensure no other cookies have been added by browser extensions or addons - just the "JSESSIONID" cookie should be present
 # Begin editing as normal
fields.summary: User is logged out when editing pages

fields.description:
Currently, any user can create new topics which clutter up the list of topics, for a number of reasons:
 # People don't realise that spaces separate topics and end up creating 2-3 topics instead of one.
 # New staff mistype the names of products or have wrong ideas about the names of products, causing multiple redundant topics.
 # People mistype while typing in topic names and then it gets autocreated with no confirmation (that in itself may be worth another ticket.)

However, to actually clean up the mess, the requirements are way too strict:
 # To edit someone else's topics, you have to be a moderator. If you're going to require that, then I think you should have to be a moderator to create new topics, too. It's called "consistency".
 # To delete a topic, apparently you have to be an admin. The only admin in our organisation is IT and we don't want to wait for IT to delete every individual topic we ask them to delete. 

One thought is that if you're going to auto-create topics when people add them, why not also auto-delete them once no questions are left on them? Then at least it's a mess which will clean itself up.

Personally, though, I think the requirements to create new topics should be higher. On Stack Exchange, you can't just create new topics as soon as you join the site, but rather you have to get your reputation up to some minimum level before it will let you create new ones. That sounds like it could work here as well.

This ticket may be a duplicate request, because I found another ticket which was similar, but resolved as a duplicate. But on that ticket, there was no link to the original ticket, so it was impossible to tell whether mine was a duplicate of that one or not. Thus, I'm filing it anyway.
fields.summary: Deleting topics should not require admin access

fields.description:
If you try to load a page with '[' in the page title, there's an "java.net.URISyntaxException: Illegal character in path" thrown.

Note: To be clear, Confluence does not produce any unencoded links to such a page (i.e. they are always correctly encoded when linking within the application). However, when you visit such a page, the browser search bar on top has the normal/unencoded link and hitting it there causes this exception page to show up.
fields.summary: Loading a page with special characters (such as [ ) in the page URL results in an exception

fields.description:
h3.Steps 

 # Create a page 
 # In edit mode drag n drop a PDF file into the editor


 *What happened...* 

You get a tiny thumbnail for the PDF document

 *What should have happened...*

You should get a regular sized thumbnail

 *Workaround* 

Toggle the thumbnail to a different size will correct the issue.  The issue is also correct at the point of publishing the page.
fields.summary: Drag n Dropping a pdf file into the editor generates a tiny thumbnail
The Scheduled Jobs administration page does not reflect the current status of jobs

fields.description: The Confluence Usage Stats plugin is not compatible with data center. We have had requests from customers to add DC compatibility. Currently, there is no built in way to view site usage statistics in Confluence Data Center.
fields.summary: Enhancement: Make Confluence Usage Stats Data Center Compatible

fields.description:
Currently when using the Favourite Page Macro, you can not change the spelling, for it to say "Favorite". If we could choose or edit the spelling in this macro, that would be great!

On [this page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/favorite-pages-macro-148581.html], Atlassian calls it the "Favorite Pages Macro" but then in the image you can see how it spells "Favourtie" when using the macro.

Thank you!
fields.summary: Favourite macro to Favorite

fields.description:
The [Atlassian Keyboard Shortcut Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf54/confluence-user-s-guide/getting-started-with-confluence/keyboard-shortcuts] does not list a keyboard shortcut for the 'Merge Table Cells' function.

This is a request to add it (assuming it does not exist)
fields.summary: Editor Shortcut for Merge Cells

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create 2 users with below data
||Username||Full Name||
|admin|admin|
|admin12|一二admin|
|admin13|一三admin|
 # User Admin12 login and create a space
 # User Admin13 login only
 # User Admin login
 # User Admin add full name "一二admin" and "一三admin" to page restriction

h3. Expected Results

Both _一二admin_ and _一三admin_ will be added to the page restriction
h3. Actual Results

Adding Fullname _一三admin_(user have login and not created space) is added successfully. 

adding Fullname _一二admin_(user have login and created space) cannot be searched

  !Capture.JPG|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Use the Username (_admin12_) instead.

h3. Note
* This problem wasn't reproduced with other multibyte characters like Katakana in Japanese, full-width alphabet but Chinese characters
* This problem also happends to User Mention feature
* This problem also happened in Team Calendar function
*- You can find the same problem when adding participants to an event in "Create event" dialog

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Using certain password regex in Crowd causes Confluence admins unable to create new users.

h3. Environment
* Confluence connected to Atlassian Crowd
* Crowd version replicated with 2.11.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have [Confluence connected to Crowd|https://confluence.atlassian.com/crowd/integrating-crowd-with-atlassian-confluence-198573.html]. Set the connection as Read and Write. Make sure that synchronizations are successful and users are able to log in.
# Use Crowd's internal directory to be connected to Confluence.
# Set the following as \[password regex|https://confluence.atlassian.com/crowd/configuring-an-internal-directory-18579551.html] for that user directory:
{code}
(?=.*[A-Z])
{code}
# Go to Confluence, make sure that Confluence has Mail server.
# Make sure that Crowd user directory listed on the highest User Directory hierarchy
# Go to Confluence Admin > Users > Add users > make sure that "*Send an email to the user you have just created, which will allow them to set up their password.*" has been ticked
# Create a user this way

h3. Expected Results
User is created, email is sent

h3. Actual Results
User is not created

 !screenshot-1.png! 
With the following error popped up:
{code}
Failed to create the user 'testuser'. Check your server logs for more information.
{code}

Below is seen in atlassian-confluence.log
{noformat}
2017-05-08 21:35:47,971 ERROR [http-nio-15104-exec-1] [confluence.user.actions.CreateUserAction] execute Failed to create user: testuser
 -- referer: http://localhost:15104/admin/users/createuser.action | url: /admin/users/docreateuser.action | traceId: 2563956fe6569a49 | userName: admin | action: docreateuser
com.atlassian.core.exception.InfrastructureException: com.atlassian.user.security.authentication.InvalidPasswordException: com.atlassian.crowd.exception.InvalidCredentialException: The new password does not meet the directory complexity requirements: The string must contain at least 1 uppercase alphabetical character
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
* Currently, the only password regex that's observed to have this issue is
{code}
(?=.*[A-Z])
{code}
* There is a variant of this issue in Jira Server: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-69642
* This Password regex is presents no problem when creating users without the "*Send an email to the user you have just created, which will allow them to set up their password*." ticked. Provided that the password set complies to the regex.
fields.summary: Certain password regex used in Crowd causes Confluence unable to create users

fields.description:
h3. Problem statement 
Sometimes Confluence undergoes issues with Synchrony and setting Collaborative Editing to 'Limited' is not desirable, especially when it takes a long time to resolve the issue with Synchrony. 

On top of that, 'Limited' mode has its own drawbacks (outlined in the [Administering Collaborative Editing|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Administering+Collaborative+Editing#AdministeringCollaborativeEditing-Changetheeditingmode] page), so it's not the most desirable option to pursue. Administrators will then opt to turn Collaborative Editing off, which in turn results in shared drafts to be lost. 

However, once the issue with Synchrony is resolved, administrators will turn Collaborative Editing back on and this results in *old* shared drafts to return. It causes confusion to users who have shared drafts from back then as old content appears in the editor again. 

h3. Suggestion
Provide Confluence administrators with a safer method of removing shared drafts by doing so via the UI instead of running SQL queries in the database. This allows the admin to clear the shared drafts whenever they turn Collaborative Editing off and on.
fields.summary: Allow administrators to remove and clear shared drafts via the admin UI console

fields.description:
This happens sometimes in the following situation.
 # A user has made edits to a page and is currently in the editing session.
 # Another user joins the editing session.

When the second user joins, he or she will sometimes see a gray version of the first user's avatar (indicating that that user has made changes which haven't yet been published) which is immediately replaced by the colored (active) version of that user's avatar (since they are currently active). Because this happens really quickly, it creates for a bit of a jarring transition as the gray avatar is immediately replaced by the colored avatar. It would be better to first display all the active avatars, then the inactive ones, instead of first displaying the inactive avatars which might be immediately replaced by the active ones if the user is currently in the session.

 
h2. Done when

* Change the order of operations so that the inactive users are added after the active users from synchrony
fields.summary: Inactive avatars immediately replaced by active avatars creates jarring transition effect

fields.description:
h2. Problem description

In Confluence Admin > Scheduled Jobs, the "Next Execution" timestamp can show timestamps in the past under certain conditions.

It seems that "Next Execution" is calculated when Confluence is started up, OR if the cron expression for the scheduled job is modified, and stores somewhere (likely in-memory). Subsequently, if that job is ran manually, then the "Next Execution" reverts incorrectly to the stored value instead of displaying the next run time. In other words, It appears to be loading a cached value that is no longer valid.

This appears to be a display problem only, as the job continues to run on schedule despite the backdated "Next Execution" value shown.
h2. Steps to reproduce
 # Start Confluence
 # Navigate to Confluence Admin > Scheduled Jobs
 # Wait for a few minutes for some scheduled jobs to run. "Flush Task Queue" is a good one to test wiith since it runs every minute.
 # Click "Run" on the scheduled job to manually run it
 # After the job runs, click Refresh in web browser

h2. Expected behavior

After the scheduled job runs, "Next Execution" is updated to show the next scheduled time to run in the future
h2. Actual behavior

"Next execution" reverts back to the original timestamp calculated during startup, which is now outdated. Hence, status is not shown correctly and history not updated.
h2. Other notes
 * In local testing, if the scheduled job is allowed to run on its own (i.e. not manually triggered) then the "Next Execution" time will be displayed correctly afterwards. However, running the job manually then refreshing the browser afterwards again will re-trigger the bug
 * This is not a problem with local browser cache and can be reproduced even when browser cache is cleared
 * The cached value is also not flushable via the UI at Confluence Admin > Cache Management. However, a restart will clear this
fields.summary: "Next Execution" in Scheduled Jobs panel displays timestamps in the past

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 20 January 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5|titleBGColor=#3C78B5|titleColor=#FFFFFF|bgColor=#E7F4FA}
After some analysis, we've found that this ticket is not a bug.
There is a feature request to implement edit restrictions to be inherited to child page at [CONFSERVER-5095 - Page edit permissions should be inherited by pages, like view permissions are|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-5095]. Please cast your vote and watch that issue for further updates.
{panel}

h3. Description

When the user set the edit restriction for the parent page. the edit restriction is not inherited to the child pages.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Login in as admin
 # Create a page and set the edit restriction to only admin can edit.
 # Create a child page
 # Log out and login in with user A
 # view the child page for the page that created in step 2
 # Click on the edit button

Expected Result
 The edit button should be disappear

Actual Result
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Set the restriction for the child page directly.
fields.summary: Edit Restriction is not inherited to child page

Getting 200 OK response

fields.description:
We want to suggest a autowatch function for every page a user has rights to read for, existing pages as well
as newly created ones.

Example:
If you use Confluence as a knowledge database you have a lot of information on many different pages.
If you edit one of those pages it is important that the new inforamtions reach every user those informations
are important for. This can be accomplished by following all pages so the user gets a notification every time
the page gets edited.
To keep the readability and general good navigation confluence up, it is often better to create a
new page instead of editing an existing one.
Lets say User A creates a new space with new pages that include new informations important for User B. After
the page was created User B might have rights to read it but wouldnt get a notification if something gets edited.
With an function to autowatch every page you are able to read (because of the rights) you don't have to worry
about if you have added new spaces/pages to your watch ones or not and be sure that your informations reach
everyone they need to.
fields.summary: We want to suggest a autowatch function for every page a user has rights to read for, existing pages as wellas newly created ones.

fields.description:
h3. Description
When the user tried to create multiple JIRA issue from a table via highlighting the rows in the table, JIRA will create an issue for all the rows in the table and user would only want to create issues for specific rows.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a table and add some 4 rows
# Highlight 2 rows and select the JIRA icon to create multiple JIRA tickets.
# JIRA create 4 tickets instead of only the 2 highlighted row

h3. Suggestion
Allow the user to create issues only for highlighted rows in the table when the user creates via the highlight feature.
fields.summary: Create issues for selected rows of a table instead of all rows of table when creating an issue via highlighting the text.

fields.description:
Can we implement an option to disable deletion of page history? This could either be a per-space or site-wide setting.

We'd like to disable deletion of page history for all of our documents so that old versions are not mistakenly (or maliciously) deleted.

The setting should also apply to the API and not just be a visual modification.
fields.summary: Allow disabling the ability to delete page history

fields.description:
Can't add an inline comment to any plain text on a page that matches the text within the summary field of a JIRA Issue that has been added to the page. This includes anything from words to single letters so long as the highlighted slice is contained within the summary text (e.g. a JIRA Issue macro containing the summary 'test SOME' will prevent an inline comment being added to 'test' anywhere on the page, or 'es' anywhere on the page, but not 'zest').

Steps to reproduced:

# Create a Confluence Page
# Add a JIRA Issues macro to the page either by highlighting existing plaintext and using create issue, or adding an existing JIRA issue
# Add plaintext to the page that matches the whole or part of the JIRA Issues macro's summary text (using different casing appears to not trigger the problem)
# Highlight the plaintext that's been added and try to add an inline comment
# Note the 'We can't add your inline comment; the section you highlighted may contain a macro or user mention. Try highlighting plain text.' error text, along with a precondition failed error in the browser's javascript console.

Example reproduction flow noted in attached screenshots.
fields.summary: Can't add an inline comment to page text that matches that contained within a JIRA Issue macro's Summary field

fields.description:
When at a blog home page, it shows all of the recent blog posts and if there are either page or inline comments on a post, it shows an "n comments" link.

The link could be misleading in case the blog post contains only resolved inline comments. The user has to figure out that s/he needs to click the ellipsis button (...) and select "Resolved comments ( n )" to see the resolved comments list.

Therefore, the suggestion is that the "n comments" link should not count resolved inline comments.
fields.summary: "n comments" link on a blog post should not count resolved inline comments

fields.description:
h5. Summary

Upgrade Confluence (connected to Oracle 12c) to version 6.1.x failed with the following error in the logs (atlassian-confluence.log) :
{code:java}
ERROR [localhost-startStop-1] [atlassian.confluence.plugin.PluginFrameworkContextListener] launchUpgrades Upgrade failed, application will not start: com.atlassian.config.ConfigurationException: Cannot update schema
com.atlassian.confluence.upgrade.UpgradeException: com.atlassian.config.ConfigurationException: Cannot update schema
	at com.atlassian.confluence.upgrade.AbstractUpgradeManager.upgrade(AbstractUpgradeManager.java:133)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugin.PluginFrameworkContextListener.launchUpgrades(PluginFrameworkContextListener.java:118)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugin.PluginFrameworkContextListener.contextInitialized(PluginFrameworkContextListener.java:77)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext.listenerStart(StandardContext.java:4853)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext.startInternal(StandardContext.java:5314)
	at org.apache.catalina.util.LifecycleBase.start(LifecycleBase.java:145)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase$StartChild.call(ContainerBase.java:1408)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase$StartChild.call(ContainerBase.java:1398)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
Caused by: com.atlassian.config.ConfigurationException: Cannot update schema
	at bucket.core.persistence.hibernate.schema.SchemaHelper.validateSchemaUpdateIfNeeded(SchemaHelper.java:174)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.upgrade.AbstractUpgradeManager.upgrade(AbstractUpgradeManager.java:119)
	... 11 more
Caused by: org.hibernate.exception.GenericJDBCException: Error accessing table metadata
	at org.hibernate.exception.internal.StandardSQLExceptionConverter.convert(StandardSQLExceptionConverter.java:47)
	at org.hibernate.engine.jdbc.spi.SqlExceptionHelper.convert(SqlExceptionHelper.java:111)
	at org.hibernate.engine.jdbc.spi.SqlExceptionHelper.convert(SqlExceptionHelper.java:97)
	at org.hibernate.tool.schema.extract.internal.InformationExtractorJdbcDatabaseMetaDataImpl.convertSQLException(InformationExtractorJdbcDatabaseMetaDataImpl.java:97)
	at org.hibernate.tool.schema.extract.internal.InformationExtractorJdbcDatabaseMetaDataImpl.locateTableInNamespace(InformationExtractorJdbcDatabaseMetaDataImpl.java:352)
	at org.hibernate.tool.schema.extract.internal.InformationExtractorJdbcDatabaseMetaDataImpl.getTable(InformationExtractorJdbcDatabaseMetaDataImpl.java:226)
	at org.hibernate.tool.schema.internal.exec.ImprovedDatabaseInformationImpl.getTableInformation(ImprovedDatabaseInformationImpl.java:110)
	at org.hibernate.tool.schema.internal.exec.ImprovedDatabaseInformationImpl.locateTableInformation(ImprovedDatabaseInformationImpl.java:142)
	at org.hibernate.tool.schema.extract.internal.InformationExtractorJdbcDatabaseMetaDataImpl.getForeignKeys(InformationExtractorJdbcDatabaseMetaDataImpl.java:655)
	at org.hibernate.tool.schema.extract.internal.TableInformationImpl.foreignKeys(TableInformationImpl.java:88)
	at org.hibernate.tool.schema.extract.internal.TableInformationImpl.getForeignKey(TableInformationImpl.java:99)
	at org.hibernate.tool.schema.internal.SchemaMigratorImpl.findMatchingForeignKey(SchemaMigratorImpl.java:529)
	at org.hibernate.tool.schema.internal.SchemaMigratorImpl.applyForeignKeys(SchemaMigratorImpl.java:505)
	at org.hibernate.tool.schema.internal.SchemaMigratorImpl.performMigration(SchemaMigratorImpl.java:314)
	at org.hibernate.tool.schema.internal.SchemaMigratorImpl.doMigration(SchemaMigratorImpl.java:136)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.impl.hibernate.ConfluenceHibernateSchemaManagementTool$3.doMigration(ConfluenceHibernateSchemaManagementTool.java:105)
	at org.hibernate.tool.schema.internal.SchemaMigratorImpl.doMigration(SchemaMigratorImpl.java:109)
	at org.hibernate.tool.hbm2ddl.SchemaUpdate.execute(SchemaUpdate.java:87)
	at org.hibernate.tool.hbm2ddl.SchemaUpdate.execute(SchemaUpdate.java:58)
	at bucket.core.persistence.hibernate.schema.SchemaHelper.validateSchemaUpdateIfNeeded(SchemaHelper.java:171)
	... 12 more
Caused by: java.sql.SQLException: ORA-01000: maximum open cursors exceeded

	at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CTTIoer.processError(T4CTTIoer.java:450)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CTTIoer.processError(T4CTTIoer.java:399)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4C8Oall.processError(T4C8Oall.java:1059)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CTTIfun.receive(T4CTTIfun.java:522)
	at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CTTIfun.doRPC(T4CTTIfun.java:257)
{code}
h5. Analysis

Running the following query in the database found out that Confluence is taking up ~600 open cursors :
{code:sql}
select a.value, s.username, s.sid, s.serial#
from v$sesstat a, v$statname b, v$session s
where a.statistic# = b.statistic#  and s.sid=a.sid
and b.name = 'opened cursors current'
and USERNAME='<INSERT-USERNAME-HERE>'
{code}

h5. Cause
This is a known bug with Oracle JDBC driver version 12.1.0.2, which leaks database cursors. See this Oracle Community forum post for more information: https://community.oracle.com/thread/3682300. 

h5. Workarounds

See [this KnowledgeBase article for detailed instructions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/upgrade-to-version-6-1-x-failed-with-error-ora-01000-maximum-open-cursors-exceeded-922914154.html].

There are two known workarounds for this issue:

*1. Update the Oracle JDBC Driver to the latest version (12.2.0.1)*
There is a new version of the Oracle JDBC driver which fixes the cursor leak. Updating your driver prior to upgrading Confluence to 6.1.x will prevent this issue.
To update the driver:
# Stop Confluence, and create a backup of the installation and home directory.
# Download version 12.2.0.1 (or later) of the driver from the Oracle JDBC Driver page.
# Replace the existing ojdbc7.jar in <Confluence installation>/confluence/WEB-INF/lib with the new driver. For detailed instructions, follow step 6 in the database setup for oracle page.
# Start Confluence.
# Re-attempt upgrade.

*2. Increase Maximum Open Cursors*
Increase the maximum open cursor in the database :
{code:sql}
ALTER SYSTEM SET open_cursors = 1000 SCOPE=BOTH;{code}
(i) The query above is obtained from [Side Bar Is Not Visible Due To Not Sufficient Open Cursors In Oracle|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/side-bar-is-not-visible-due-to-not-suficient-open-cursors-in-oracle-780863319.html]. You may change the value of '1000' as required.
fields.summary: Upgrade Confluence to version 6.1.x Failed with "ORA-01000: maximum open cursors exceeded" Error

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When spinning a Confluence instance from CloudFormation Template, you get the option to specify a various number of parameters. If you want to enable HTTPS for that instance, you will need to specify the parameter *SSL Certificate Name*.
After saving or updating that stack, the LoadBalancer requires a reference to a valid SSL Certificate.

h3. Environment
AWS

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start Cloudformation Template
# In the Steps, Enter any value for the parameter *SSL Certificate Name*
# Continue with the Setup


h3. Expected Results
The Setup should be completed and the instance should start normally


h3. Actual Results
Creating/Updating the stack fails to configure the LoadBalancer because it requires a valid reference to an SSL Certificate.


h3.Workaround
No workaround at the moment
fields.summary: CloudFormation Template is not providing a reference to an SSL Certificate when entering SSLCertificateName parameter

fields.description:
h3. *Current Situation*

At the moment, you must be space administrator in order to create, edit and delete templates.
h3. *Problem*

The creation of templates is often a task for 'normal users' which have a special role inside a team. Especially, this counts for larger teams working together in one space. These users should not have the ability to change the permissions inside a space.

Because the permission to create templates comes with the space admin permission, it's always difficult to realize a distributed template management because this means that these users are also able to change space permissions.
h3. *Solution*

Add another two columns to the space permission table like 'Templates Add & Delete'.
fields.summary: Separate creation of space templates from space administrator permission

fields.description:
It would be really helpful if a user can control their own trash directly from their profile.

*What each user can* *achieve***
 * View deleted pages in a popup window
 * Purge all pages
 * Purge and Restore individual pages
 * See who has deleted their page
 * How long their page has been deleted for
 * List what space their deleted page is kept

This option puts the responsibility of deleted documents in users hands and allows them to restore a page if someone accidently/maliciously deletes anything.
fields.summary: Allow users to control their own trash - User Profile
Editor flickering behavior in IE 11

fields.description:
As a Confluence administrator, I should have the ability to enable or disable many of the system plugins in the environment via the web console.

One of the things that has always made Confluence so powerful is the ability to customize the tool to suits our needs. This is huge for our business as we must tailor the application to fit our unique needs.

The ability to disable certain system plugins along with being able to customize the environment heavily using java script to suit our needs is what we loved about older versions of Confluence. In recent versions, the ability to disable or enable certain system plugins via the web console has been disabled.

This is also a problem when upgrading from older versions in which modules were disabled; those modules can no longer be re-enabled without a database query.

 The system plugins critical to enterprise customers needing this functionality (ability to disable) as reported thus far are:
* Spaces button and dropdown
* People link
* Logout
* Marketplace
* Profile pics 
* Gadgets
* Blogging
* Anonymous content 
* Username hover popup
* Office Connector features

(i) This is not an exhaustive list, but they are frequently unneeded features.

Also, we would like changes to system plugins such as this ability to be documented in the Confluence release notes.
fields.summary: Ability to enable or disable some system plugins as an Admin

Make the page tree to be visible in sidebar for all the page

From the [Configure the Sidebar documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/configure-the-sidebar-317194694.html#ConfiguretheSidebar-Addingcustomcontenttoasidebar]:

When replying to an inline comment and using an @mention, the mentioned user does not receive a *<username> mentioned you in <pagename>* email nor a notification in the workbox

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure an [outgoing mail server in Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/configuring-a-server-for-outgoing-mail-151078.html], if one is not already present

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When users are passed links to spaces they don't have access to, they receive a "Page Not Found" error screen with a nebulous "page does not exist or you don't have permission" error. If the "Contact Administrators Form" feature is enabled a user will be able to contact the system admin to request access, but system admins may not be in the best position to evaluate access requests.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an option to customize this error message with contact details for the *Space Administrator* so the user can reach out to them directly. Alternatively, extend current "Contact Administators" functionality to be context-sensitive and provide an option to contact the space administrator.

h3. Why this is important
Time is lost if a system administrator has to confer with a space administrator regarding adding access for a user.
fields.summary: As a user I want to be presented with the contact details for the space admin when I receive a permissions error when accessing a space

Actual result

Expected result

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you bring a custom field into Confluence via a Jira Issues Macro and that Custom Field has a space in the name you cannot sort any fields in the Jira Macro.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an application link between Confluence and JIRA.
# Create a Custom field in jira names "test field"
# Add the custom field in a jira issue macro in Confluence
# Note how none of the columns are now sortable
# Replace the field with the cf[xxxxxx] number
# Note how the fields are now sortable.

h3. Expected Results
I would expect that you should be able to sort all columns always in the JIRA issues macro.


h3. Actual Results
You are not able to sort the columns in the JIRA issues macro if you include a custom field that contains a space in the name.

h3.Workaround
You can use the custom field number to work around this issue. custom field numbers look like cf[xxxxxx] You can just replace the name of the custom field with the number and it will work correctly.
fields.summary: JIRA issues macro cannot sort on a custom field that contains a space in the name.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, in order to use a paid plugin in Confluence a license has to be purchased that matches the user license in Confluence. This causes an issue, for example when an instance is set up for 2000 users, but only ~100 users use this macro.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow for smaller licenses to be purchased, and set up plugin permissions to only allow the amount of licensed plugin users to use the plugin. 

h3. Workaround 
No existing workaround other than purchasing the full plugin.
fields.summary: Allow for smaller plugin license based on usage

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When migrating from Cloud to Server, Collaborative editing will not work. This is due to the fact that the base-URL settings are not applied to the instance.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud site export
* Issue found in Confluence 6.1.1 and 6.1.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Export Confluence Cloud site following instructions in [Create a Site Backup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/create-a-site-backup-724765526.html].
# Install Confluence 6.1.1 or 6.1.2
# When prompted to restore a backup in the installation process, upload the site backup created in step 1.
# Once the site has been restored, you will notice that Collaborative Editing is disabled.
# Try to enable Collaborative Editing. You will notice errors in the UI.
# If you try to edit a page, you get the error "Loading the editor is taking longer than usual"

h3. Expected Results
Collaborative Editing is enabled and will work.

h3. Actual Results
Collaborative Editing will not enable. In some cases, the startup logs will show that the base-url is \{\{NULL}} which appears to be the primary cause of this issue. 
 
h3.Workaround
There is a simple workaround to get Collaborative Editing to work after the restore: 
# Go to !https://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/444107050/cog.png!> General Configuration
# Click \{\{Edit}} in the Base-URL section
# Click \{\{Save}}
# Go to the *Collaborative Editing* tab on the left hand navigation bar
# Click \{\{Restart Synchrony}} and make sure Collaborative Editing is On

Collaborative Editing should work after saving the Base-URL in *General Configuration*.
fields.summary: Collaborative Editing breaks after Site Import from Cloud to Server

h3. Summary
Upgrade hangs on EmbeddedCrowdAddMissingConstraintsClearDataUpgradeTask when upgrading to 5.10 or above

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Connect Confluence 5.9 or below to LDAP to pull 50k+ users
# Run the upgrade past 5.10

h3. Expected Results
Upgrade completes as expected

h3. Actual Results
The upgrade hangs on:
{noformat}
2017-04-25 18:16:09,646 INFO [localhost-startStop-1] [atlassian.confluence.upgrade.UpgradeTask] doUpgrade UnindexContentTypeUpgradeTask for status
2017-04-25 18:16:09,653 INFO [localhost-startStop-1] [atlassian.confluence.upgrade.UpgradeTask] doUpgrade UnindexContentTypeTask enqueued
{noformat}

h5. Notes
The query that it hangs on is the following:
{code:sql}
SELECT DISTINCT membership.id as id1_29_0_, membership.parent_id as parent_i2_29_0_, membership.child_group_id as child_gr3_29_0_, membership.child_user_id as child_us4_29_0_ 
FROM cwd_membership membership, cwd_membership mem2 
WHERE (membership.id <> mem2.id 
       AND membership.parent_id = mem2.parent_id 
       AND (membership.child_user_id = mem2.child_user_id 
       OR membership.child_group_id = mem2.child_group_id));
{code}

For instances with very large user bases, this takes a long time to complete.

h3.Workaround
# Delete the external directory that has all of these users from !http://i.imgur.com/Ew0T0kz.png! *-> General configuration -> User directories*
# Run the upgrade
# Re-add the directory connector
(!) This is not recommended if you have an external directory set as 'Read only with local groups', as these memberships will be lost 
OR
# Wait for the upgrade to complete, it will just take longer than usual
fields.summary: Add constraints upgrade task is very slow in instances with a large amount of users

fields.description:
When using labels starting with non-ASCII but acceptable Latin-1 characters (such as å,ä,ö), the Labels List macro auto-groups the labels in a strange order. Se attachment.

This behaviour should be corrected to use the sorting order of the locale (or let the editor choose the grouping). In the attached picture, "ÅÄÖ" should follow Z in the Swedish alphabet.

Thanks in advance!

/Emil
fields.summary: International sorting in Labels List macro
